posts.name: FredK
posts.cooked:
Is it possible to share a variable studio across different documents in Onshape so that all the sketches are updated by just changing the variable studio in one document? If so, can you outline the steps?

We have set up our documents like they suggest in FRC Designs and the Spectrum videos, but haven’t figured out how to link a single variable studio.

posts.name: Calvin Selin
posts.cooked: I’m not sure about a variable studio, but you could make a featurescript that you can update.

posts.name: Eric Bergquist
posts.cooked:
I’ve found that there aren’t very many variables that are important enough to deserve this sort of treatment. However, a few like the depth and width of the drive train meet the criteria. In lieu of having a multi-document variable studio (which I don’t believe exists), you can get a similar effect by using the FRCDesign approach of deriving a sketch with those dimensions baked into it from the parent document. Then constrain your child document sketches to that derived sketch. You won’t have the actual numbers of the variables easily visible, but the dimensions will update when the parent document variables are changed.

If you want those variables available, you can always grab them from your derived sketch by creating a new variable and using the “measured” option.

posts.name: FredK
posts.cooked: You seem to be grossly overestimating my CAD skills

posts.name: Calvin Selin
posts.cooked: It’s actually not hard at all.  I can post a guide for you.

posts.name: FredK
posts.cooked: We’re kind of wondering that. Thank you for that suggestion. Your solution is probably better. I watched the video on deriving and remembered/learned that changes to the parent need to be versioned for child documents to know there are updates.

posts.name: Zach Hoegberg
posts.cooked: Definitely what @kitare102 suggested, proper top-down design with derived master sketches is the way to go.

posts.name: Calvin Selin
posts.cooked: I use a featurescript I made for things like standard hole sizes.  that way if we change the standard hole size for our bearings, I can update it, then it’ll push out to every document that uses it.

posts.name: Evan Sigl
posts.cooked: there is a featurescript called “super derive” that allows you to derive variables, I would recommend using the mastersketch with baked in dimensions tho, much cleaner
